text: Welcome to the AWS Studio, Luca.
Thanks so much for joining us.

Thank you, Robbie, it's
a pleasure to be here.
Let's get started.
Why don't you tell us a little bit more
about your role at Capgemini?
For sure.

I'm Luca Ghirotto, I'm the
Head of Advanced Networks,

an international team working
on the network evolution,
network modernization at Capgemini.

Tell me more about
Capgemini's cloud journey.
Capgemini is a global leader in

consulting technology services
and digital transformation.

For sure it is at the
forefront of the innovation

in several topics, for
example, cloud connectivity,

digital and software
engineering platforms, and more.
Helping clients in their journey
toward the intelligent industry,
supporting them in some crucial phases,

for example, from strategy to
design, to managing operation.

To achieve this, Capgemini
is relying on more than
360,000 employees.
Means engineers, scientists,
business developers, business managers,

over 50 countries worldwide
and across several sectors.
For example, energy and utilities,

finances, and for sure
telecom media and technology.
So how is Capgemini using the cloud
to transform your business today?
Yes, our business is heavily involved
in at least four major trends.

The first one is the
network cloudification
that is targeting to have
open and multi-vendor network ecosystem

through the containerization
of the network functions
deployed on the cloud.

The second one is the development
of 5G digital services

that requires to have a
cloud native approach.
Number three are the 5G private networks,
in order to have fastest access
and agile use cases development.

And the last but not
least, the sustainability.

Sustainability is having
an ever increasing role
and will be increasingly central

in all the main interaction
between the telco players.
Particularly referring to the 5G and Edge,
we have been participating for some years
supporting important players in the world.

So let's talk a little bit
more about your relationship

with AWS and how we've
been able to support you

through developing
these new B2B solutions.
What do you value most
about your current collaboration with AWS?
Yes, in the network cloudification,

the relationship with
AWS was able to leverage
dedicated CI/CD automation tools,

thanks mainly to the
infrastructure as a code
paradigm shift made available by AWS.
For sure we can refer to the lower TCO
enabled by the transformation,

let me say, from fixed
costs into variable costs.

In addition to seamless
error free operation.

Regarding the development
of 5G digital services,

Capgemini has implemented
a microservices approach,
moving much of the functionalities,
the computing from devices to the cloud.
And this kind of modularity, let me say,
allowed us to deploy our solution
both in environment, standard environment,

AWS region for example,
and the edge cloud.
And this kind of modularity is giving us

very good flexibility
in terms of solution.
Regarding the 5G private networks,
we are defining specific blueprints
in order to have a 5G PVN hosted on AWS.
And regarding the sustainability,

I think that the example
I'm going to show you today
to describe to you today,
is an example of collaboration for sure.

So we've talked about the
infrastructure evolution

and how it's been used to
transform your business.

Namely infrastructures
code, containerization,
let's talk about the application.
So what exactly did you build

and what was the customer
problem it solved?

Yes, as we all know, telco
players are demanding,
strongly demanding cost saving for sure,

avoiding or reducing
the initial investment
to set up infrastructure,

fast deployment, and
deactivation of services

in order to target
initially the B2B model.
As we wanted to demonstrate how easily,

how effectively can be 5G
use case implementation,
leveraging both the 5G connectivity

provided by a telco player
and the cloud hosting
provided by AWS.
We developed this relationship last summer
in order to provide a specific use case

for an important tier one in
Europe for an utility company.
So concretely speaking, I'm referring to
remote assistance solution whereby
experts located in some central rooms,
give to experts in front of the equipment.

So in field support,
in terms of operation,

in terms of troubleshooting,
in terms of all the activities,

fixing activities, crucial in
a live environment, for sure.

This solution is also
including capabilities
regarding the computer system.

Also the object recognition
and smart glasses,
for example to interact in an easier way.

Clearly there are similar
solutions in the market,

but ours, I think, is able
to integrate many components
and this is key for sure.
The last point to highlight here is

the remote, the word
remote, that is very key
because our client can reduce

in sending experts in
field with their car.
So reducing pollution and the CO2 level.

I think this is a concrete
example of attention,
to the sustainability.
And once the solution will scale,
I think we can add a specific layer on top
to the embed layer there is,
thanks to the cloud itself.

Just think the lower
emission from facility,
thanks to the reduced power usage
and the hardware footprint.
What I love about this solution,
it almost feels like it's multi-layered
in its sustainable approach.

It's not only architected in
the cloud to be sustainable-
[Luca] Yes.

[Robert] But the underlying
use case is sustainable

removing the need for
further carbon emissions.
So maybe tell me a little bit more

and help me quantify the
impact or customer benefit.

What else did your end customer
see through this project?
The solution was tested
and deployed in AWS in around 10 days.

So, let me say, very
quickly and effectively.
And the clients said many times,
listed many times several benefits.
For example, the cost saving, for sure,

the operation and
troubleshooting reduced time,

reduced risk to have wrong
actions in operation,

and the possibility to use
scalable and flexible procedures.
How did AWS support you
through the implementation journey,
as well as the deployment?
AWS has supported us in the design
of the containerized environment,

in order to achieve the
best performance application

and meeting, let me say,
all the requirements

in terms of connectivity for
example, bandwidth and latency.
And for sure supported us in defining
all the complementary service set in order

to be able to achieve
the overall solution.

I think the collaboration
was very reactive,
very responsive, very, very good.

So thank you very much
for this collaboration.
We appreciate the opportunity-

[Luca] It's an example
to replicate for sure.
[Robert] Well said.

And we appreciate the
opportunity to collaborate.
I mean such a great example
of the customer seeing a direct benefit,
not just from the evolution of networks

but complimented with next
generation edge infrastructure.

So many opportunities to
leverage our continuum

of edge infrastructure from
the Snow family, to IoT,

to local zones, AWS Wavelength,
everything in between.
Just a tremendous use case in general.
But maybe I'll ask you,

let's look to the future
for a second here,

what do you think the next
level of B2B applications
with 5G connectivity might entail?
Yes, well, we have some ideas for sure.
The first one is to launch new

or existing 5G trials, free
trials for enterprises.

Sort of, let me say,
try and buy initiative

that is very important in
order to stimulate the market.

And we need to stimulate
the market because we needed
to increase the 5G monetization.
Other areas could be for sure next steps
regarding the telco OSS and BSS systems.
And for sure we need to have a focus also

in the end to end quality
of services solutions.
And finally,

it's very important to
keep developing use cases,

having a special focus
on the sustainability.

For sure, we needed to create
other concrete examples
in such as a strategic area that needed
to become a priority for all of us.

Couldn't agree more, and
a fascinating use case

and customer outcome you
described here today.

So thanks so much for joining
us in the studio here, Luca.
[Luca] It's a pleasure.

[Robert] And really
appreciate you joining us.
[Luca] Thank you very much.
